title: Inventory and VAT Financial Accountant
content:
Fender Musical Instruments Corporation is a world-famous brand with offices across the globe. Fender was born in Southern California and has built a worldwide influence beyond the studio and the stage. A Fender is more than an instrument; it’s a cultural symbol that resonates globally.
About the role
We have a unique opportunity for a Financial Accountant - Inventory and VAT to join our Finance, based at our Fender EMEA head office in East Grinstead!  Reporting to EMEA Finance Manager, this role will ensure compliance with UK and EU Vat rules, maintain accurate inventory provisions, balance sheet control, supporting the annual audit process, and maintaining strong internal controls and governance.
Key relationships




Internal


External





US Group Finance
Sales operations
Senior leadership
Supply chain & warehousing
FP&A
IT




Auditors
Tax advisors
HMRC
Banking





Main Responsibilities

Ensure compliance with all company policies and standard operating procedures and identify/establish internal controls and ensure their operating effectiveness,
Preparing concise, accurate, timely and detailed general ledger account reconciliations and journal entries according to specified corporate formats and deadlines,
Assist with month end reporting to ensure adherence to group deadlines.
Preparation and submission of UK & EU VAT returns, EU Sales Lists, and duty administrative support,
Preparation of Duty, Freight and Warranty Accruals
Responsible for UK & EU compliance with various regulatory environmental reporting requirements,
Assisting with balance sheet forecast and annual budget, working with Hyperion, including variance analysis versus budget and prior year.


Responsible for complex intercompany accounting and reconciliation


Responsible for complex inventory reconciliations and sales cut off calculations


Maintenance of the group fixed asset register and providing CAPEX analysis to support heads of department


Provide support and information for statutory EMEA audits and group requirements,
Maintaining records and documents for company secretarial purposes for UK and EMEA companies,
Identify process improvements and implement once approved
Provide further ad hoc support to the Finance Manager and Financial Director where required
Ad hoc projects and tasks

This is an indication of the main responsibilities of the role and the Company reserves the right to amend the content of the role at its discretion.
Person Specification
Essential Skills/Knowledge/Experience

Part qualified/qualified accountant, AAT, ACA, ACCA or CIMA equivalent
Ideally candidates will have 1-2 years’ experience in a similar internationally focused role
Practical experience of statutory and fiscal reporting for medium sized companies
Knowledge of accounting under FRS 102 regulations
Prior experience of complex intercompany accounting
Previous exposure to inventory reconciliation and reporting
Proven VAT experience,
Strong excel skills
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Attention to detail
Deadline driven with the ability to remain calm under pressure
Proactive
Multi-tasking, flexible and adaptable
Knowledge/Experience of Intrastat & EU Sales Listing,

Desirable Skills/Knowledge/Experience

Exposure to FX and multi-currency accounting
Previous exposure to inventory reconciliation and reporting
Knowledge/Experience of Intrastat & EU Sales Listing,
Knowledge of US/IFRS GAAP,
SAP,
AS400
Hyperion,
Additional language skills would be an advantage, including French, German, Spanish, Swedish or Italian
